attributes.action: stop the 29% rise in SIA licence fees that must be paid in order to be allowed to work
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We the undersigned are opposed to a 29% rise in licence fees, (that have to be paid in order to be allowed to work), to cover the inabilaties of the SIA to be self funded. 
We want the licence fee to remain as it is currently, (£190), until the SIA can offer rock solid evidence of change within the industry or factual evidence of enforcement & compliance.

government_responses.details:
You recently signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "stop the 29% rise in SIA licence fees that must be paid in order to be allowed to work."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.number-10.gov.uk/output/Page11201.asp

Prime Minister's Office

Petition info: http://petitions.pm.gov.uk/cannotpay/
